2.text: I have heard many such things, Miserable comforters are ye all.

3.text: Is there an end to words of wind? Or what doth embolden thee that thou answerest?

4.text: I also, like you, might speak, If your soul were in my soul’s stead. I might join against you with words, And nod at you with my head.

5.text: I might harden you with my mouth, And the moving of my lips might be sparing.

6.text: If I speak, my pain is not restrained, And I cease—what goeth from me?

7.text: Only, now, it hath wearied me; Thou hast desolated all my company,

8.text: And Thou dost loathe me, For a witness it hath been, And rise up against me doth my failure, In my face it testifieth.

9.text: His anger hath torn, and he hateth me, He hath gnashed at me with his teeth, My adversary sharpeneth his eyes for me.

10.text: They have gaped on me with their mouth, In reproach they have smitten my cheeks, Together against me they set themselves.

11.text: God shutteth me up unto the perverse, And to the hands of the wicked turneth me over.

12.text: At ease I have been, and he breaketh me, And he hath laid hold on my neck, And he breaketh me in pieces, And he raiseth me to him for a mark.

13.text: Go round against me do his archers. He splitteth my reins, and spareth not, He poureth out to the earth my gall.

14.text: He breaketh me—breach upon breach, He runneth upon me as a mighty one.

15.text: Sackcloth I have sewed on my skin, And have rolled in the dust my horn.

16.text: My face is foul with weeping, And on mine eyelids is death-shade.

17.text: Not for violence in my hands, And my prayer is pure.

18.text: O earth, do not thou cover my blood! And let there not be a place for my cry.

19.text: Also, now, lo, in the heavens is my witness, And my testifier in the high places.

20.text: My interpreter is my friend, Unto God hath mine eye dropped:

21.text: And he reasoneth for a man with God, And a son of man for his friend.

22.text: When a few years do come, Then a path I return not do I go.
